text: I think actually yesterday when I was
going to sleep I was thinking about what
my children or what my brothers would go
through walking keep walking get on your
knees get on your knees
for the next generation it's gonna be
occurring from inception I'm I'm 23 in
my life I've never seen anyone get
killed before let alone someone died in
front of me and she's four and she has
to consult her mother and that is that
alone shows the plight of the next
generation two things might happen one
may be being very numb which I kind of
feel now with my generation you wake up
every morning and it's kind of something
new I can only picture black children
looking at these things and for years to
come and then remembering those images
when they leave their homes when they
interact with police officers or others
in positions of authority but then I
also see a lot of in our future
generation getting very angry in a
productive way I think when you're
constantly seeing how much violence can
be done to you to people who look like
you it's like you're reliving it all the
time when I think about the new
generation I think about how is a 23
year old this is already becoming
commonplace for me I have personal
concerns with the ubiquity of the
violence itself but also the way it's
shared you become desensitized to done
and then they you know they appear on
your timeline on Facebook Instagram and
Twitter and you just you scroll past
them like it's nothing but in fact it's
it's a dead person lying there everybody
is being reduced to a hashtag because
it's such a common occurrence
everybody's becoming more immune that
has to stop but the hashtag has to keep
going on at the same time because it has
to be known you know we're being we're
raising a generation that now knows what
it looks like to have young black men
killed by the police their youth will be
expedited they're no longer able to
enjoy being youthful I have a stepsister
and she's seven she has a phone so I
know she's seen something and I think
about who's comforting her in class when
she sees this video you know in school
you know future generations I'm hoping
that we don't have to have the same
conversation over and over again but
that's what probably our parents were
saying 50 years ago
